Intervention: All subjects had the Meso BioMatrix Acellular Peritoneum Matrix implanted along with a tissue expander during the first stage of breast reconstruction. After tissue expansion, the tissue expander was replaced with a breast implant during the second stage of reconstruction.
Eligibility: Undergoing unilateral or bilateral, two-stage, tissue expander-assisted breast reconstruction
Agreement to return for the trial required follow-up visits
Prior reconstructive breast surgery, breast augmentation, mastopexy or reduction mammoplasty
History of radiation therapy to the chest
Pre-operative treatment with induction chemotherapy for breast cancer
Participating in another investigational drug or device trial that has not completed the follow-up period
Results: Rate of Breast Related Adverse Events

Investigators evaluated each subject and each reconstructed breast for the occurrence of an adverse event from the first stage of reconstruction through the final follow-up visit. A breast related adverse event was defined as any untoward medical occurrence related to a reconstructed breast.
Arm/Group Title: Meso BioMatrix Acellular Peritoneum Matrix

Arm/Group Description: All subjects had the Meso BioMatrix Acellular Peritoneum Matrix implanted along with a tissue expander during the first stage of breast reconstruction. After tissue expansion, the tissue expander was replaced with a breast implant during the second stage of reconstruction.
Type of Units Analyzed: Reconstructed breasts  Measure Type: NumberUnit of Measure: Reconstructed breasts affected: 12
